channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: A Wealth of Well-Being
item.description: Finance practitioners can benefit from Meir Statman's challenge to make finance an “afterthought” and spend more time thinking about life well-being.

item.title: China has a ‘near monopoly’ on many critical minerals. JPMorgan says it could be the ‘next battleground’ with the U.S.
item.description: The U.S. is 100% reliant on imports for 12 minerals that are key to the production of semiconductors and other high-tech products.

item.title: What’s Your Client’s Optimal Equity Allocation?
item.description: Note to investment advisors: You may be overestimating the risks of equities for conservative investors with longer investment horizons.

item.title: Ashton Kutcher sides with the enemy over actor and writer colleagues in AI debate: 'I can just generate and then watch my own movie'
item.description: Writers push back at the venture capitalist’s praise of OpenAI’s Sora.

item.title: Gold and Inflation: An Unstable Relationship
item.description: While there are periods when gold has hedged inflation quite well, beware blanket claims of gold's inflation-hedging utility.

item.title: The housing market’s pivotal spring selling season is coming to an end—not with a bang, but with a whimper
item.description: Capital Economics says “mortgage demand and sales activity won’t recover until rates fall meaningfully below 7%.” The research firm expects that to happen only later this year.

item.title: Monetary Policy and Financial Conditions: Meaningful Relationship?
item.description: An analysis of the Fed's recent rounds of quantitative tightening (QT) and quantitative easing (QE) yields actionable insights about the relationship between monetary policy and financial conditions.

item.title: The S&P 500 is crushing diversified funds. So if you didn't bet big on the U.S. stock index, 'then you look like a moron,' portfolio expert says
item.description: Diversified portfolios have trailed the US large-cap stock index in 13 of the last 15 years, a stretch seen only once before in almost a century of data.

item.title: Five Quotes from Financial History to Guide Trustees
item.description: If you serve as a trustee of an institutional investment plan, these five quotes may help guide your decisions for the benefit of those who depend on your stewardship.

item.title: The biggest announcements from Apple's most important event of the year—and quite possibly ever
item.description: Artificial intelligence—rather, Apple Intelligence—was the centerpiece of the company's keynote for WWDC 2024.
